text: Martinez "Marty" Joseph Hewlett (born December 6, 1942) is Professor Emeritus of Molecular and Cellular Biology at the University of Arizona.The Ledger for January 28, 2006 He received his PhD in 1973 and served in David Baltimore's laboratory. His specialty is researching Bunyaviridae.AAAS Profile He is an adjunct professor at the Dominican School of Philosophy and Theology of the Graduate Theological Union and a lay member of the Dominican Order.Australian Broadcasting Corporation Hewlett has written two books on the relationship between science and religion with Ted Peters,CTNSISSR for Ted Peters as well as the novel Sangre de Cristo: A Novel of Science and Faith, republished as Divine Blood.Science and the Spiritual Quest edited by W.
